result.execSummary:
The defendant Alicia M Canales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with coactor.
No possession of any firearms.

Attend and complete parenting class.
Any additional treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully compelte recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.   Department of Corrections must conduct random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions;  firearm possession and voting.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Court waived any costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA due to inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alicia M Canales

records.addlTxt: Received & Filed, PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Original Transcript (34 pages) commencing MARCH 17. 2017 by RISA KRAMER.
Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (715) 246-3680 and mailed to:  Superintendent Skalski, St. Croix Correctional Ctr. P. O. Box 36, New Richmond, WI  54017-0036
Amendment to Judgement of Conviction and Order - CIP, received and filed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 24, Judge Protasiewicz. os.
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 78 MONTHS with credit for 62 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 30 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 48 MONTHS.  

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court WAVIED any costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA due to inability to pay. 

CONDITIONS OF  EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct random urine screens.
- Attend and complete Parenting class.
- Any additional treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
- No contact with co-actor. 
- Maintain employement. 
- No possession of any firearms
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m). 

Jury trial vacated on 04-03-2017. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement; 
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Alicia M Canales in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Alicia M Canales in custody.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his/her Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.
Letters on behalf of the defendant, received and filed. tk

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Alicia M Canales not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced for Court.  At the request of counsels, this matter is adjourned for plea and sentencing in Br. 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Alicia M Canales not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Defense enters a demand for speedy trial. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.
all other conditions remain the same.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court, defendant Alicia M Canales not in court, in custody. Katherine Seelow for Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.  Return on bench warrant held. Court vacated bench warrant. Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court sets bail of $7,500. Defense requests scheduling conference date.   All parties are notified that pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 17-02 as of February 2, 2017 this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant missed court on 04/05/2016.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 01/20/17 at 8:30, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) gj
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office.

Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court.  
Zachary A Wittchow for Marissa Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Bail review hearing.  Defendant discharged from Justice Point.  Defendant notified by defense counsel of this hearing.  

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Bail/bond hearing on March 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Due to a misunderstanding at Justice Point, bail review is moved from 03/10/2016 at 1:30pm to 03/11/2016 at 8:30am.

Defendant Alicia M Canales in court with attorney Debra J Patterson for Jeff Allen Schwarz.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant Alicia M Canales in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alicia M Canales in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Pecora informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Defendant will report to the Public Defender's Office to see if she qualifies for appointment.  Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Alicia M Canales not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defendant Alicia M Canales in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Defendant Alicia M Canales in custody.  Zachary Wittchow for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Defendant Jessi Torres
